intro: Euphrasia ceretanica, commonly known as the lesser eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with distinctive dark spots, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Euphrasia ceretanica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
